travel_tip: This is a multi-day trip. St. Louis (near the St. Charles charger) is a great place to stop for the night. Crossing the Rocky Mountains into Denver can be slow, so allow for extra time on the final leg.

stops.soc_recommendation: Arrive with ~20% SoC. A 30-minute charge will get you to ~75%, perfect for the next leg.

food_stops.name: The Oasis Southwest Grill
food_stops.description: A popular local spot for classic American fare and a friendly atmosphere.

stops.soc_recommendation: Arrive with ~25% SoC. This quick charge will get you to 70-75% to comfortably reach the St. Louis area.

food_stops.name: RARE Chop House
food_stops.description: An upscale dining option known for quality steaks and a fine dining experience.

stops.soc_recommendation: Arrive with ~20% SoC. Charge to 80% while you explore the historic downtown or check into your hotel.

food_stops.name: Kabab N Kurry
food_stops.description: Offers a menu of traditional and flavorful Indian kababs and curries.

food_stops.name: Asia - Ameristar
food_stops.description: A culinary tour of Chinese and Southeast Asian cuisine located within the Ameristar casino.

lodging_option.name: Drury Plaza Hotel St. Louis St. Charles

stops.soc_recommendation: Arrive with ~30% SoC. A quick 15-minute top-off is all that's needed for the short hop to the next stop.

food_stops.name: India's House
food_stops.description: Serving authentic Northern Indian cuisine to central Missouri for nearly fifteen years.

food_stops.name: HuHot Mongolian Grill
food_stops.description: A create-your-own stir-fry restaurant with a fresh market of ingredients and sauces.

stops.soc_recommendation: Arrive with ~25% SoC. This is a good spot for a longer 35-minute charge to get back to ~80%.

food_stops.name: El Vaquero
food_stops.description: A local favorite for classic Mexican dishes and a vibrant atmosphere.

stops.soc_recommendation: Arrive with ~20% SoC. A 30-minute charge will get you to ~75% for the next leg across Kansas.

food_stops.name: Globe Indian Food
food_stops.description: Offers a menu of classic Indian dishes in a casual setting.

food_stops.name: HuHot Mongolian Grill
food_stops.description: Another location of the popular create-your-own stir-fry chain.

stops.soc_recommendation: Arrive with ~25% SoC. Charge back up to 75-80% to continue your journey west.

food_stops.name: Swagat Fine Indian Cuisine
food_stops.description: Though a bit of a drive, it's known as one of the best Indian dining experiences in the region.

food_stops.name: Imperial Garden Express
food_stops.description: A convenient option for quick and classic Chinese-American dishes.

stops.soc_recommendation: Arrive with ~15% SoC. This is the longest charge stop, perfect for a meal. Charge to 90%+ for the high plains.

food_stops.name: Tikka Shack
food_stops.description: A modern, casual spot serving up traditional Indian dishes and simplified pairings.

food_stops.name: Tryyaki Asian Cuisine
food_stops.description: A family-owned drive-thru restaurant serving Chinese and Japanese cuisine.

stops.soc_recommendation: Arrive with ~30% SoC. A 30-minute charge will get you to ~80% and ready to cross into Colorado.

food_stops.name: Terra Bona
food_stops.description: A local coffee shop and eatery known for quality ingredients and a cozy atmosphere.

stops.soc_recommendation: Arrive with ~25% SoC. This is the final, quick top-off to ensure you arrive in Denver with a high state of charge.

food_stops.name: Oscar's Bar & Grille
food_stops.description: A classic small-town grill for a final break before reaching the city.

rest_areas.name: Gateway Rest Area
rest_areas.location: Mile Marker 25 on I-64 W, Illinois
rest_areas.description: A good stop after passing through southern Illinois, before reaching the St. Louis metro.

rest_areas.name: Mineola Hill Rest Area
rest_areas.location: Mile Marker 173 on I-70 W, Missouri
rest_areas.description: A scenic stop with historical markers about the Daniel Boone and Sante Fe trails.

rest_areas.name: Colby Rest Area
rest_areas.location: Mile Marker 49 on I-70 W, Kansas
rest_areas.description: A modern and well-maintained facility, a great place to stop in western Kansas.

scenic_spots.name: Gateway Arch National Park
scenic_spots.description: A must-see detour. Ride the tram to the top of the iconic 630-foot arch for incredible views of the city and the Mississippi River.

scenic_spots.name: Kansas City
scenic_spots.description: A significant detour, but worth it for its world-renowned BBQ, jazz music history, and numerous fountains.

scenic_spots.name: Eisenhower Presidential Library, Museum & Boyhood Home
scenic_spots.description: A fascinating stop for history buffs, exploring the life and career of the 34th U.S. President, Dwight D. Eisenhower.

kid_friendly_stops.name: City Museum
kid_friendly_stops.description: An incredible, one-of-a-kind museum that is essentially a giant, surreal playground for all ages, made from reclaimed architectural objects.

kid_friendly_stops.name: Union Station Kansas City
kid_friendly_stops.description: A beautifully restored train station that houses Science City (a hands-on science center), a planetarium, and other family attractions.

kid_friendly_stops.name: Sternberg Museum of Natural History
kid_friendly_stops.description: Famous for its incredible fossil collection, including the 'fish-within-a-fish' fossil. A great stop for dinosaur-loving kids.
